definition:
A finite quantum group $Q_{Gf}$ is a pair $(\mathbb{H},\Phi)$ of a
finite-dimensional $C^*$-algebra $\mathbb{H}$ with a comultiplication
$ \Phi$ such that $(\mathbb{H},\Phi)$ is a Hopf $^*$-algebra.

Note that one obtains the dual Hopf algebra of a commutative, finite
quantum group via Fourier transformation of the group’s elements.
